alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 26 at 2:48PM PDT until March 28 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 2 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 18 to 30 inches in the Mount Shasta area, including along I-5 Weed to Dunsmuir and Highway 89. Total storm accumulation 2 to 3 feet in the Ski Bowl area. Winds gusting up to 65 mph over exposed areas. * WHERE...Southern and western Siskiyou County. This includes areas south of Weed along Interstate 5, highway 97 east of Weed, highway 89 east of Mount Shasta, the community of Tennant, and surrounding higher terrain. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 2 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected Monday night through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
